since_last_update: Dominant change: White House signaled then moved to nominate Kevin Warsh as next Fed Chair; cross-asset reaction has been USD-firmer / precious-metals weaker and risk assets more cautious into confirmation/clarity (FT, Barron's, AP).

Gold/silver reversal accelerated: sharp drawdown after a parabolic January run, framed as a mix of policy-regime repricing (hawkish/orthodox read-through), USD bounce, and position/technical unwind (FT, Barron's).

Equity index-futures tone turned more risk-cautious (NQ more sensitive than ES) as the Warsh headline adds policy-path uncertainty premium; risk-off impulse also reinforced by megacap earnings dispersion (Microsoft weakness noted in market wrap) (AP, Yahoo Finance).

Macro tape since last run added mixed global signals: Germany flash GDP slightly firmer while Germany prelim CPI hotter than expected (tension between growth and inflation in Europe), and Canada monthly GDP softer (LOCAL).
today_focus: Primary driver today: Fed leadership regime signal (Warsh nomination) and its second-order effects via USD strength/real-rate expectations and risk-premium (FT, Barron's, AP).

Gold focus: outsized downside volatility from crowded positioning/overbought unwind after record highs; watch whether USD bid persists and whether the selloff broadens into broader risk de-leveraging (FT, Barron's).
US equity focus: duration vs cyclicals split risk—policy uncertainty + any rates repricing tends to hit NQ/megacap multiple support first; breadth/dispersion likely elevated (Yahoo Finance, AP).

Rates/FX focus: whether the market treats Warsh as hawkish enough to reprice cuts OUT (USD up, real yields up, NQ down) or treats the move as ‘independence clarity’ reducing tail risk (USD up, vol down); direction is not fully settled yet (FT, Barron's).

market_pricing.dominant_driver: Fed leadership / policy-regime uncertainty premium (Warsh nomination) transmitting through USD and real-rate expectations; strongest visible in gold/silver reversal and NQ sensitivity.

rates.inferred_bias: Two-sided: headline initially supports USD and can be read as hawkish (less aggressive cuts), but the market recently had been leaning toward multiple cuts; near-term risk is a fast repricing of the cut path either direction as Warsh stance is reinterpreted.
what_to_watch_today: Front-end rate expectations (Fed funds/OIS) for confirmation whether cuts are being priced out or not
Real-yield proxy moves vs gold (divergence would signal positioning/technical dominance rather than macro)

equities.inferred_bias: NQ under relative pressure vs ES if USD/real rates firm; ES more resilient if growth/cyclicals hold up. Earnings dispersion remains a key amplifier.
what_to_watch_today: Megacap post-earnings follow-through and breadth (advance/decline) to gauge whether this is ‘tech-only’ vs index-wide derisking
Intraday reversals around Fed-speaker windows and late-day flow/imbalance

fx.inferred_bias: USD supportive on perceived hawkish/orthodox Fed-chair pick and reduced policy-tail narratives; if USD keeps firming, it is mechanically hostile for gold and typically tightens financial conditions at the margin.
what_to_watch_today: DXY trend persistence vs prior-day move

commodities.inferred_bias: Gold risk skew still down near-term after crowded rally reversal; stability requires either USD cooling or clear re-anchoring of rate-cut expectations. Oil appears less dominant today vs policy headline but remains a tail-risk channel via geopolitics.
what_to_watch_today: Gold stabilization vs further forced liquidation signals (continued broad precious-metals weakness)
Any renewed geopolitical headlines that reinsert safe-haven bid

risk_register.risk: Policy-regime repricing whipsaw: Warsh nomination interpreted as (a) hawkish -> cuts priced out, USD/real yields up, NQ pressured; or (b) reduces Fed-independence tail fears -> vol compresses; two-way risk is elevated until more details/confirmation path is clear.
Positioning/technical liquidation in precious metals spills into broader risk: the gold/silver reversal could trigger margin/VAR-driven de-leveraging across risk assets if volatility persists.
Earnings concentration/breadth shock: megacap-driven index moves remain outsized; a single large print can dominate ES/NQ regardless of macro.
Europe inflation surprise (Germany prelim CPI hotter) complicates global duration relief; if bund yields rise meaningfully it can tighten global financial conditions and cap US equity multiples.
Geopolitical headline reversal (Iran/oil): can quickly reintroduce inflation-risk framing and risk-off correlations, conflicting with the current Fed-cuts narrative.

event_warnings: Jan 30: Chicago PMI (14:45 UTC / 09:45 ET) — usually second-tier but can reinforce ‘growth resilience vs slowdown’ framing if a surprise hits during fragile positioning.

Jan 30: Fed speakers Musalem (17:30 UTC / 12:30 ET) and Bowman (22:00 UTC / 17:00 ET) — watch for any pushback/validation of market cut expectations; can move front-end and NQ on real-rate sensitivity.
Next week: confirmation/shortlist/White House messaging on Warsh nomination path — headline risk remains high while details and Senate dynamics are unclear (AP, FT).
